main event: A civilian reported observing a singular oblong object traveling from southeast to northwest in Yellow Springs, Ohio on March 22, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed for a duration of approximately 15 minutes., The sighting occurred during good visibility conditions with a clear sky., The altitude of the object was estimated to be around 1,500 feet., No physical evidence or sound was reported during the observation., The report was part of the Project Blue Book investigation.
witness description: a civilian who reported the sighting
